answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
    I have been looking into your question and I found some documents that may offer assistance. The first one listed below includes guidelines on what to study for the library employment test in Illinois. 
http://www.state.il.us/cms/download/pdfs_testgde/23421.pdf
In New York they use the same test for Library aides as all other entry level clerical positions. I have included below the guidelines for that test and sample questions.
http://www.cs.state.ny.us/testing/test_guides/entry_level_clerical.pdf
As to the validation aspect of your question, I was unable to find any exams posted on the internet that were listed as validated. I did find a guideline from the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission which includes details about approved employment tests and selection procedures.
http://www.eeoc.gov/policy/docs/factemployment_procedures.html
I hope these help. Does anyone else know of a validated library employment test that they would not mind sharing? 
Ali Iannolo
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Chinn Park MAGIC
text: We would like to know if anyone is using or knows of a validated test for hiring library aides or pages.  (pages shelve the books and perform other clerical tasks). We currently have a test, but are interested in finding one that is validated.  If you have a validated test, would you share it? Thanks!
